intro: Hieracium ausserdorferi subsp. vulgatiflorum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces seeds in a spherical head, typical of the daisy family. Due to its hardy nature, it is often considered a weed in agricultural and garden settings.
